dt: {bc}a low-growing, erect, Eurasian shrub ({it}Vaccinium myrtillus{/it}) having blue or bluish-black fruits that resemble blueberries but are borne singly rather than in clusters
{bc}the sweet, edible fruit of the bilberry used especially in pies and jams
{bc}the dried fruit or an extract of this fruit used as an herbal remedy
Both the plant and its fruit are also called {it}whortleberry{/it} and (chiefly Scottish) {it}blaeberry{/it}.
{bc}any of several related plants (such as {it}Vaccinium caespitosum{/it}) or their fruit

et: {it}bil-{/it} (probably of Scandinavian origin; akin to Danish {it}bølle{/it} whortleberry) + {it}berry{/it}
shortdef: a low-growing, erect, Eurasian shrub (Vaccinium myrtillus) having blue or bluish-black fruits that resemble blueberries but are borne singly rather than in clusters
the sweet, edible fruit of the bilberry used especially in pies and jams; also : the dried fruit or an extract of this fruit used as an herbal remedy
any of several related plants (such as Vaccinium caespitosum) or their fruit
